one_reviews_text: This is a fantastic adventure that makes you think, but has just enough hints to keep you from getting frustrated.  I was genuinely sad when I completed this since I wanted it to continue.  Hopeing there might be a VR sequal sometime soon!

one of the most exhilarating games I have ever played. it is a combination of the Da Vinci Code and Indiana Jones. I am brand new to VR games, this one is very realistic, and the graphic is top-notch. 

You get addicted to it and you will have the urge to finish it to know what is going to be next. if you love mystery with a hint of horror this is the game!

review_title: Must have for any VR user
one_reviews_text: I really couldn't stop playing this, it draws you in always wanting more. Classic resi style puzzles, amazing graphics and very clever how it gets you to interact with the objects around you. It's not an open exlore game but it really doesn't need to be, sit back and enjoy hours of fun! Highly recommended, no spoilers but the last room spooked me out, definitely my favourite!

I'm a 30 year PC and console gamer.. just got my first VR headset with a Quest 2... This game is really good. My girlfriend and I played it simultaneously on seperate Quest 2's. She is not a very experienced gamer but she loves escape rooms and she loved this game. We had a really good time talking thru puzzles and how we had each figured them out... plus we were able to give each other subtle hints a couple times when we got hung up.  The Room VR is a great game.. I hope they make a sequel soon.
Well made vr puzzle game. The puzzle not that hard but not easy neither. And there are no jump scare but the atmosphere still great and creepy. Very suitatable for vr new comers.

If you are fan of escape game in real life, you will love this game !!
This game it's look like real, and you feel like a detective into a great mysterious aventure !
Mechanics seems real, and puzzle are sometimes very hard but not impossible and the feeling when you manage to open something is incredible ...
Buy this game !

This is just an amazing game from start to finish. The graphics and interaction are faultless. Sometimes I'd just stand there and look around.
There are no points in the game where you're made to jump or be scared, just an eerie atmosphere sometimes.

This game shows off what vr is really capable of. Buy it.
A great overall VR experience for anyone who wants to feel truly immersed in a game!
I can't even begin to imagine the effort that went into designing and developing this. Outstanding. Thank you
This is how all VR puzzle games should be! Excellent fun for hours! Great rooms full of mystery and clever puzzles. Please make a sequel...

yes great game but ...i would have liked a free movement .i am only at the start in the egyptian  room so  far.being a 70 year old i loved it but would have smoother movement like halflife alyx ....!  am i allowed to say that.?

Yes! loved it!. Must admit I did get stuck for a little bit in the church so didnt play for a few weeks but when I came back to it I remembered how good of a game it is. Graphics & sound are fantastic and the puzzles are wacky, weird and delightful!

review_title: This is what VR was made for
one_reviews_text: enjoyed the gameplay very much and I want more!

review_title: Really great - but so quick to complete!
one_reviews_text: Really enjoyed this. It took me around four hours to complete, but I did use the hints a few times when I got really stuck. Hope more games like this are made ... it could be a really great niche for VR.

Great game! I ran through all their mobile games and was so excited, to see a version for VR! It feels so immersive. When playing the mobile games my feeling was "this has to be for VR!" Fireproof Studios deliver quality here as on the other platforms. Can't wait to get another installement.
Sometimes, VR hands feel a bit clunky and there are some actions that work on mobile, but haven't been implemented here. Like combining items in the inventory or manipulating items in inventory. 
Doesn't bother me that much. Loved the puzzles. Loved the scenerie. Graphics and sound are great!

Bring it on, fireproof!

It's like everyone else, if you like puzzle game this is a must play, don't even wait for a sale, it's worth the price. I enjoyed it so much and you really need to think it's not obvious puzzles like adventure games. When I finished it, I bought the entire "The room" collection on Steam, those games are so fun.

If you have played the Mobile "The Room" Games you know they are quality games, and this one is no exception, this may be the best one so far. I played it on PC and it runs great, the gameplay makes you think and the visuals are something else. If you like puzzle games this one is a must.

I absolutely love the Fireproof mobile games and when I saw they had brought it to VR I was so excited. They did not disappoint with this game. The artwork is beautifual (as always), the sound effects are satisfying and the puzzles are so much fun. 

I sincerely hope that they have another game in development.

I LOVED this game! The graphics are extraordinary, the puzzles are very interesting, and it is a super long story with several hours of several chapters. Completely worth every penny and I wish this developer would get all of their games added to Rift!! 
I’ve got 4 other games of theirs on my tablet and I’d buy every single one for my Oculus!
You won’t regret it, GET THIS GAME!
Great game. Amazing atmosphere in VR.
This is a great game in so many ways from it's design to it's graphics to the execution of the gameplay this is a top notch game and I hope they do a lot more in the future.

Fireproof have done it again. I played The Room series on andriod a couple of years ago and at the time I was a bit disappointed to hear their next title would be VR. However, two years later with a PC and VR headset I see exactly why they made that decision, this style of game lends itself to very well to VR. 
I wouldn't normally have parted with £20+ for a VR title, but it was well worth it.
I look forward to their next release.

Free movement and smooth turning would be nice in the future.
Enjoyed it

review_title: Amazing game to play solo or with a bud
one_reviews_text: I loved the original game for iOS so when I saw this on the Oculus Store I had to  give it a try.  It's not the longest game but most VR games aren't terribly long.  It was very atmophseric and did a decent job at being creepy in VR. My daughter and I had a great time with this one!

Lovely game, graphics are excellent as expected, but the game is too short!! I mean 30$ for a game that can be played in about 2-3 hours max! Either add more levels or lower the price. Its way overpriced at the moment.
My daughter and I have really enjoyed this atmospheric puzzle game.

This game has converted my husband from hardcore anti-gamer into a VR enthusiast.  The graphics are amazing, the environments are immersive and compelling.  All of the puzzles seem very well thought-out and all of the mechanics are smooth.  This is one of the absolute best puzzle/escape exerpeinces I've had with a video game and by far one of the best games for VR that I've seen so far.  Worth every bit of the full price.

That's literally all I have to say! This is an excellent game. The story is top notch, the mechanics are near flawless, and the graphics are stunning to match. If you're a fan of puzzles, escape rooms, or adventure games, you need to get this game!

Just finished the game. The ingame-tips are very good with their three stages, didn't have to google once for puzzle-solutions. The Graphics are very nice with love for the detail. The sound is awesome too and adds to the overall perfect atmosphere. Also good playtime for the money.
Thanks to the devs for this great game. Enjoyed it! :)
Nothing to complain about, both my girlfriend and I loved it! The complexity of the puzzles were on point all the way through.

This game was amazing!  The visuals were incredible and the puzzles were just challenging enough to keep you engaged, without being frustrating.  I really enjoy going to escape rooms and this game providing a similar experience, while actually being more entertain than most.   This is exactly what I would have wished for when it comes to VR!

I have just completed The Room in VR, and it has been one of the most interesting experiences of VR that I have ever had. Even my wife was impressed, and she does not usually like this sort of stuff. My only regret is that I have finished the puzzles. However, as I have all of the iPad versions, I will be re-visiting those puzzles, but turning off the hints. Fireproof Games, you have excelled yourselves...take a bow!

If you are a fan of am immersive puzzle game, I highly recommend this one. I however feel you should play the 'The Room' games in the app store on your mobile device. This game is the ending and a wonderful bridge to the games. This game always impresses each and every sequal. I will never not recommend this title on all platforms. If you are cautious about the money but have it, buy it!!! It's too good to miss.

Design, craftmanship, artistry, imagination. Please, Fireproof Games, let me join the chorus of voices engouraging you to keep going. My money is ready for your next title. Don't rush on our account - we understand craftmanship takes time - but perhaps no vacation for Chris, Tony and team for a little while?

I finished this game a few days ago and just helped my sister finish it today. 100% worth the money, hands down. Sometimes the puzzles were confusing or I missed something to do the puzzle, but the hint are helpful and set you in the right direction. I personally recommend standing up to play but sitting works well too. 5/5 stars!
Brilliant puzzle game! The only downside was that I completed it in just under 4 hours; £22.99 for 4 hours worth of game. Not so great.
What a game well worth the money , probably the best escape room game I've played so far 👌

This is the best puzzle VR program to date.
Whatever you do DON'T READ ANY WALKTHROUGHS !!
Did this mistake only once and then I thought "How didn't U think of that ?"
You will have many "Eureka !" moments if you work this on your own.
Do you yourself a favour and get this game. ASAP.
This is probably the best vr quest game for now
this game was great! awesome story, amazing graphics, challenging puzzles! i had goosebumps soooooo much while playing this, this is a must play!

I have played and loved all the Room games but this adds a further dimension. Its a must for all puzzle game lovers. It's a little short as are most VR games but the quality is amazing.  Can't wait for the next episode.
best game ever played , but i finish it in 1 days.. excelent details , the game in fact is very good for beginner

ok so I started out playing these games on mobile and absolutely loved them. Having this game come out in VR just blew my mind. Game play was pretty easy to get the hang of and the ability to move the angle of view of what you are looking at brings a whole new level to the game. While I am a little sad that it only took me two days of play to finish the game I absolutely loved it and cant wait for more to be released. Really though if you like puzzles or puzzle boxes and like a horror them this game is increadable and you will absolutely love any of the games in this series.

I saw my husband playing this game, and it looked like Myst. I hated Myst. But this game is much more intuitive, and so much fun! There is also a way to get hints. Not answers; HINTS. There are three hints possible to give, and each one gets more detailed. I used it a few times, and all but one was because I didn't see something specific in the room or just let me know I was on the right track. It's very helpful. The puzzles are fun and not too repetetive. I loved it!

What a fantastic experience. I played The Room on my iPhone a couple years back and when I saw this for Oculus I had to get it. My only regret is that I got through it so fast. If another installment came out I would buy it without even thinking about. Well done everyone.
NICE
I absolutely adored this game. I hope they make a sequel.

I played most of the mobile games of the same name.  This one is very7 well done, the environments are detailed and awonder to behold.  The only downfall of this game is it is fairly short.  That asside, it is well worth the cost!  Excellent Game!  I highly recommend this one, especially if you love puzzle games.
Wish I could forget all about it and play it again. So much fun!
I hate that the only option for movement seems to be teleportation.

This is almost everything yhou wished a point and click adventure could be.
The puzzles are very logical and not ridiculously hard or illogical;
Look for clues, manipulate things and see what happens, put the thing in the thing shaped hole, etc.
There are a couple of new mechanics that are used really well.
Tricky enough to steal 6-7 hours of your time, but reasonable enough to leave hints off.
Also, having hints on, doesn't make them auto pop-up which is nice. You need to actively pull a tab in your inventory to see them.
I only used one when I got stuck for quite a while because I didn't realize I could manipulate something. Other than that I was able to figure most stuff out by looking around for clues and just playing with the objects.
While there isn't really a whole lot of story, there's just enough I suppose.

Really fun, great atrmosphere.
Played the whole thing in a comfy chair and had no issues.
Works well sitting or standing.
I really hope we see more of this genre in VR.
And I would definitely pay for another Room game.

I loved this game.  As someone new to "video games", with VR my first real experience, this story/game was wonderful.  Full of surprises and the hints were incredible.  Please keep making more games like this!  Great job!

I have played all the Phone/Tablet Room Games, and have always wanted to play them in VR as I felt the format would fit very well. My only wish was that it had been longer and more intricate like the app games. Even with that, I give it 5 stars and really hope there will be more.

I've played every Ipad game and i've always found these games amazing. The VR experience was my first and I really felt emersed. This game gets a full 5 stars. No one has been able to create a game like this. I wish they would make a Saw VR experience. I have no doubt Fireproof would create an amazing horror experience like no other!

I have just completed The Room and it was possibly the best vr experiance so far. The settings were beautifully atmospheric with great tension building from the start. I spent about ten minutes just sitting in the hedgewitche's house enjoying the ambiance! The puzzles were just right; not too hard and not too easy but you have to think, look around a lot and experiment. I used the hints twice but i think there was only one that i dont think i would have got and i had to go online to find the answer as i was completely stuck. I cant fault the game at all and i can now see why it has scored so highly. Especially great if you're Call of Cthulu lover!

These games where fantastic on the ipad and even more consuming in VR!! I would LOVE to see them come out with more in VR with longer play time!!  I've yet to find anything as elegant and engaging as this game. PLEASE MAKE MORE!!!

review_title: Fireproof Games nailed the VR experience
one_reviews_text: I have always loved the asthetics and puzzle designs of The Room games so being able to actually enter "The Room" in VR took that gaming experience to the next level. Finishing the game left me wanting MORE!  The details in all the puzzle objects and environments was 10/10. I thought the scale changes that were woven into the storyline really added a dimention (no pun intended) that could only be truly experienced in VR.   Awesome game and a perfect match for VR.

review_title: Great - especially for The Room fans
one_reviews_text:
This is a great game. If you've ever played any of The Room games on iPad, you'll love this game. It adds such realism to The Room.. having to turn your head to look at what's on the wall... etc... it's great. The graphics are fantastic. 

The only feedback I would give is to allow us freedom to walk around the rooms. It would actually make the game more challenging, because we wouldn't know where to go. 

I hope there will be sequel!
I loved every second of it. I hope they have many more installments. Enjoyed this new addition to the series!

review_title: The best VR experience I've had in years
one_reviews_text:
What a great game! The art, story, music, puzzle design all work to great effect. Everything just feels right, and gets bigger and cooler as the story progresses so there's never a dull moment. The use of VR is also spot on, I haven't had this much fun in a headset in a really long time.  

My only suggestion would be to make it longer and allow for multiplayer so friends can join in the fun. Really looking forward to the next one!

review_title: This is what vr was made for
one_reviews_text:
The most immersive escape the room game I have ever played. Every single environment had me wowed, turning 360, looking over ledges and peeking around corners. I think I will return to this one, if only to oggle at the scenery!

I originally played natively on the Quest 2 but thought this game deserved the full graphical experience of a good gaming PC, so I switched over to the rift version.

Also - prepare to be a bit scared, especially if you play standing up...
very funny and smart. With VR seems to be there!!! I hope they will create another game like this soon...!

I've played all of The Room games on iPad, and this was such an incredible conclusion (at least, it felt like a conclusion. I felt satisfied by the ending). If you haven't played anything in the franchise before, that's fine. It definitely doesn't require playing the others, though I highly recommend them all! One of the most satisfying games I have ever played in VR.

Even though I liked the conclusion, I would like to be clear that if Fireproof Games decided to make another game, I would be overjoyed. Such incredible atmosphere and storytelling. I'm sad I don't have another to play right now. :)

I'm new to VR so I wasn't sure what to expect from the games, but this seems like something VR was made for. The graphics are really pretty with so much attention to detail, the puzzles are interesting but not completely obscure, and the sense of atmosphere it creates is haunting. It's exactly how you'd expect to feel as the protagonist in a Victorian horror novel. I hear that there are other 'room' games, I will be hunting them out!
Good VR interaction and amazing Puzzle designs
The price-performance ratio of the game is spot on. It is very atmospheric and does a good job on keeping you wondering what will happen next. Great game!
If you like the other “The Room” games, you’ll LOVE this one. Even if you’ve never played one before, make sure you get this one. Highly recommended.

I have played all of the room games. Little did i know this game would be so impressive. The Developers have never skimped on detail and did not in the VR. I felt like i was at these locations. Nothing was left untouched in the detail department. This one was magical. The small glimps of the other games past was cute.  PLEASE PLEASE Make another or something similar. Other VR Devlopers TAKE NOTE This is how you do it right. If i could give more than 5 stars i would!

This is a great game to get you started in VR. Love the atmosphere, love the puzzles, hints were useful, never got stuck. Definitely craving more from this developer. Hopefully more freedom of movement in the next game. GET THIS GAME!!!

I will say right off the bat that I am a fan of The Room series of puzzle games. I find the puzzles very satisfying and the atmosphere immersive. Both of these positives are magnified 1000x in VR.

As someone who has logged at least 100 hours in VR this game still did a great job of making me feel like I was in a tangible place, even without freedom of movement. I believe this might be the game's greatest strength. Because there is no movement I'd be willing to bet that this would be a great title for VR beginners, while still showcasing the sense of place and immersion that makes the medium so incredible.

Buy this game.

This puzzle game is hands down my favorite VR experience. The depth that VR adds to this sort of game is amazing and very well used. If you at all like puzzles, do yourself the favor and get this.

Please make another. And another. And another.
Thanks fireproof for such an amazing game, best game experience in years.

review_title: Very satisfying with alot of Aha moments
one_reviews_text: The puzzles are moderatly difficult but very fair. Only complaint I have is some of the controls could be optimized. (no reset position buttons, and a dedicated button for the eye lens would be nice). Other then that its a great game. I hope they expand upon it in the future.

I played The Room Three on PC a couple years ago and it was an unforgettable experience. So when I saw that they made The Room VR I was so excited that I bought it before I even got my VR setup (Quest 2). I was NOT disappointed. The only complaint I have isn't even about the game/experience, but the fact that I started playing the Quest version, then switched over to the PC VR version for better graphics and the save didn't transfer over. So I had to run through everything I had already done. But I honestly don't care because the game is such a great time.

It's challenging, beautiful and has a dark, ominous and mysterious story.
This is by far, one of the best puzzle games I have ever played. Was instantly drawn in, and was very sad when it ended. I will DEFINITELY be doing another play through!!

I've been a Room fan since the first app and loved all the sequels.  This game takes a huge step in advancing an already immersive experience and succeeds in keeping the experience feeling like the apps while trying newer and much bigger things.  And here's the best part: I still don't understand the story at all!!!  xD

This is one of the best VR experiences I have ever enjoyed.  Fireproof is one of those companies I'm genuinely happy to shove my money at.
Fantastic game to play as a couple. We took turns and it was a wonderful time

This is a VR escape room, except you don't have to worry about other people. It is moderately difficult, I got through it in about 5 hours with hints. The mechanics of it and the atmosphere are abolutely perfect, and will make you fall in love with VR if you haven't already. My only gripes: There aren't more of these games yet, and I can't go back and experience it for the first time again.

This is going to sound like a lot of other reviews, but for the price, there's not a ton of game. The puzzles that are here are satisfying to solve and there are some impressive visuals in places with a genuinely creepy atmosphere, but even without the hints, the game holds your hand a bit too much for my liking. You'll probably be done in about 3-4 hours if you're relatively competent.

I have played all parts of "The Room" series on smartphone over the last 7 years and I simply love the gameplay, the atmosphere and the complexity of the puzzles and the love for the details. So I was very excited for the first VR adaption. And I am just blown away. This is what VR is meant to be like.

Finally fully emerging into the universe of the null-element. Fantastic graphics, tricky puzzles to solve, the controls with the Ocuculs motion controllers are just so good, so intuitive, so precise. A must-have, worth every penny. Just played the first 2 levels, hope there are as many as in the mobile phone games and the fun won't stop too soon.

Only one thing: Please fix the issue that when teleporting the direction of view stays the same as the starting point. It would be much better to have a default view at each spawn point directly pointing the player to the puzzle or thing of interest.
Another hit from Fireproof Games. I really enjoyed playing this game.

review_title: Great Game, Wish it was longer
one_reviews_text: Me and my GF played this together me in the headset and her assisting and we both loved it, Please make another!

review_title: This is how you make a vr game
one_reviews_text:
Worth every penny!!! Don't hesitate buy! 

After playing all the mobile games over the years  I was sooooooo worried about this game and how it would feel in VR. The excitement was real and OMG it was worth the wait. This is an amazing game, true to the style, true to the mechanics and true to the mystery. It definitely feels like a room game, graphics are awsome. Tho I must admit I'm only 2 hours in and the thunder and lightning keeps scaring me, my arm hair is on end the entire time. Well done developers, please continue to make more of these games. You've done it. Thank you. 

I wasn't a fan of the teleport and no locomotion at first but when I started playing I quickly realised how it helps keep u on track and prevents you  trying to interact with pointless things. Please please please make more :)

review_title: Best oculus room escape so far.
one_reviews_text: Not sure why theres a one star review. I loved it so far. Best room escape game on oculus. Comparable but more extensive than i expect you to die. Ive completed the first two chapters and nearly the third and no complaints so far.  I hope devs keep adding more chapters.

Oh My God, can a game get any better than this? I purposly stop playing the game because I don't want it to end! Simply amazing graphics, very Myst like but indoors. I don't want it to end. Please make a sequal.

If you've played any of the previous mobile versions then you've got a good idea of what to expect. It's another lovely blend of well judged and smart puzzles that err on just the right side of head scratching to give the 'I'm a genius!' or 'Durrr.. That was so obvious!' effect just about every time. 
It translates to VR perfectly with the assorted interactivity required with the various doodbabs and general pokey twisty puzzles. 

It's not amazingly long but isn't brutally priced either. Was pleasantly surprised to see it on the Quest as well so cross buy bonus if that's a swing factor for you. 

A sweet little distraction to get through all this lockdown horror.

I have all "The Room" games available, and thoroughly enjoyed them all.  This one has a great balance between environment and focus on the puzzles.

The graphics are fantastic, with some areas feeling huge and imposing to dramatic and even homely, with a some creepy effects to enhance them.

The sounds and music will remind experienced players of the room but also add so much depth giving to the environments  (trying not to say anything to give spoilers here).

I agree with some of the other reviews suggesting the ability to walk around the environments but adding perhaps obvious areas on the floor where you know a puzzle will take place when you get close to one ?

Also perhaps have a 'hard' mode where there are more puzzles added in for those who want a deeper challenge and keep a 'normal' mode to appeal to the wider audience.

I loved it, wished it went on and on, I am already really looking forward to the next one.  Perhaps continuing with the character and learning more of the lore of "The Room" ...

I've been a huge fan of The Room for sometime now. Spent hours on my phone playing and have always wondered what it would be like in VR.... well let me tell yeah! It's some cool creepy fun :) 

At the moment i'm stuck in a church. Seem to not be able to slide some bars from the inside of a piano. Might have to wait for a walk through. Yes it's challenging at times. A few "duh" moments slaping myself on the forehead but yeah still tuff.

I'll keep my review short. Simply this is my favourite puzzle VR game so far. The puzzles, gameplay, design, comfort and the story are masterfully crafted and well thought. I didn't had a single issue with this game and enjoyed all of the level challenges. I want more of this and I hope this going to have a sequel! Well done Fireproof studios.

This is a highly polished and extremely engaging VR puzzler with creative mechanics drawing from all previous entries in The Room series. My only complaint is the length - it doesn't overstay it's welcome, but it left me hungry for more. Fingers crossed that Fireproof adds additional chapters, and if not, that the next iteration in the franchise has free locomotion! A memorable and atmospheric experience from start to finish.
Loved this game . Wish it was a little longer play through though. I'm hoping they come out with another one. Well worth the money  in my opinion.
My wife and couldn't stop playing until we beat it. Too short though!!! Hope to longer versions of this game. Very enjoyable.
Very much enjoyed this puzzleing game, struggled a bit in the cathedral level with the organ but over all this was a very fun game and would definetly recommend it to anyone who likes puzzle solving.

review_title: A great game but really short
one_reviews_text: I really like the game but it is short compared to the previous room games.  I also had less trouble with the puzzles (this is the first room game where I didn't use any hints). I think the puzzles are more logical than in the previous room games.  I really like that, but I think that it also is what makes the game easier. All in all a good game but a bit on the short side.

so, i played through all of the room games excpet for old sins, but other than that, 10/10 games, loved em, me and my dad loved them, and when i saw this i bought it as soon as i could, its a new experience where there is more to it, it is very odd, and unique. fire proof games amazed me again, hope they make another room VR, because i would play it, and i would love it. Should buy, unless you dont like unique and hard puzzles, it amazed me how much you move around, unlike some other room games, because you moved around the entire room, not around one or two objects. i absoloutley loved it, and it made me happy to play

I have played every Room game that came out on mobile and loved them, so when I saw that this had come out on VR I had to buy it!

Gameplay was brilliant, exactly what I expected from anything "Room" titled. I just wish that it had been longer (perhaps that is because I had to complete it in one sitting!) Hopefully there will be more Room VR games in the future!

This game is amazing. The puzzles are fun, the atmosphere is perfect, the details are incredible.  I loved playing The Room on my iOS devices, and was very impressed with the VR version.  However, for what I paid, I thought this game would last me quite a lot longer than it did - it took me 4 hours total to beat from beginning to end, and a good chunk of that was spent just looking around and taking in all the details. When it was over, I was very disappointed.

I have played all the variations and have waited patiently for the VR version. Now that it's finally here and I've enjoyed it, I am extremely satisfied with my experience. My friends and family will continue to enjoy it until hopefully, the next release. I know pulling this content together and stringing them into a thrilling adventure like this isn't simple - Please continue to make these !

it's got the feel of the rest of "the room" games, but somehow the motion controls seem a bit clunky compared to the touch screen. It's also a lot easier than the previous games, and the final section is practically on rails. There are too many sections where the clues are blatant. The only section where I used any hints was when it wasn't obvious that a switch had 3 positions instead of two (and of course the hints assumed I knew, and didn't mention it.

This is by now the best VR game I've ever played. It's really catchy. I did not have a single bug while playing. I felt like it was getting a little easier at the end, but maybe I was just getting used to the mechanics.

I've played the other non-VR version of this game and enjoyed them, but in VR this game comes alive. Interesting puzzles, the hints are a little to obvious but there are optional.  Great game worth the price.

The game keeps the sense of mystery from all the previous The Room games, giving you a beautifully intriguing environment to explore. The atmosphere is tuned to keep you interested with new but interesting mechanics in every new area. Definitely worth a buy (though the experience may be a bit short, depending on how quickly you complete the puzzles - I suggest taking your time to absorb the lore and the details).

I have loved The Room series from the beginning and was so excited to see there was a version for Rift!  This is what VR is made for!!!  In this game you will travel to different locations very escape room type puzzel solving with NO TIMER! Hints if you get stuck on something. 
I hope they make LOTs more in this series for VR!!!

review_title: One of the best escape room games in VR
one_reviews_text:
This is one of the best escape room games in VR I ever played and I'm a totally a fan of escape rooms and stuff. The riddles are often complex and you have to think about it from time to time. I really also love the atmosphere of the game.

Just a little sad to have no free movement and that's over so soon, but i really loved the experience, thank you for that!

If you like the movies National treasure, Raider of the lost Ark, and Sherlock Holmes, you will love this game. It was a pleasure and a joy to play this game especially in vr. The graphics is outstanding! The story is great and intriguing. You will not be bored. There are hints to help you along the way if you get stuck. I cannot wait for the next chapters that these developers make.

I love The Room and finished the other 3 games on the iPad. Played this maxed out (render scale on 1.0) on an Oculus CV1 with a RTX 2080 Super - looked good and played well but there were still a few jerky moments. The controls are teleport only which can be a little sickening for some. The game play is pretty good with puzzles you would expect, if a little easy. After completing it, my main concern with this game is that it is only about 3-4 hours long.

review_title: They're Coming Out Of The Bushes
one_reviews_text:
This game was great. I wish it was longer and harder. Hahaha. I just said that in a genuine way about the game. Didnt even mean it in "that" way. The way that a Karen would  get angry at. I did the last bit right now on a cannabis gummy. That was too scary. It was far too real. I just googled how to spell "real" by spelling real
in a google search. 

Proudly so, I have never been confused about the differences between there, their, and they're. My nose is pointed up as I'm saying this.

For a second I thought there was a frosted mini-wheat with a cartoon face on it on my box of Frosted Mini-Wheats. Turns out there really is. 

I really enjoyed the game. I do wish it was longer and harder. In the non-phallic way. The glues were fairly. Hahaha clues is what I meant. The glues are truly fine. Sorry for slandering you, glue. The clues or puzzles were easy to figure out. But I iamgine VR is so different. But I'm not invested in the rest of this paragraph. I can't keep my mind pointed at the screen. My mind is like a floating magnet that you have to focus on keeping straight up or it will fall over. 

First time being high I was at my friends house like 6 months ago. As I was and am over the leagal age to be able to partake in such things, and he gave me a gummy. And all I remember from that night was this conversation with his wife. 
Friends Very Pregnant Wife: I cant wait to go back to the gym. But we have to wait until the baby is 1 years old to be able to go at the childcare secting of the Gym.
Super High Me: What? Why! You should go right away and drop her off after 3 months
Friends VP Wife: They won't allow child under 1 years old
SH Me: They don't know how old that baby is!
I proceeded to laugh uncontrollably for 15 minutes. Even now, it still so funny. 

And outside, the rain let up just a little.

Wow what an amazing game!  I've been playing the room series on the smart phone for quite some time and this VR experience was awesome too!  I finished the game and it was amazing!  The puzzles arn't too hard for you too figure out and they arn't too easy to be boring.  Great job!

This game is just amazing once you give it a chance. It seems confusing in the beginning then once you understand how to play the game there are a multitude of puzzles that took a lot of thought by someone. 

In comparison to a lot of the garbage in the VR store I can say this is worth the money.  Use the Eyepiece and follow the hints. I wish there were more games with this much thought put in them.

I've played all the Room games, and when I saw the did this VR game... I knew it was going to be amazing... AND IT WAS. They did an amazing job. I really hope they come out with more games.

I love that they did call backs to their previous games for those who know them. I would HIGHLY recommend. Nobad jump scares but does a really good job of creepy undertone. 

10/10

this is a game I was looking for. Smart, logical and intuitive puzzles, interesting storyline, amazing graphics and very immersive. The only drawback I would mention that it is quite short. It took me only 10 hours to play. But it's worth it!

I was pretty hyped the whole time i was playing, once i completed a puzzle i would get happy and my favorite thing is what they can do with one little object and how they could put in a lot of hidden things that you would have to solve. The ending is just what i hoped for 100% worth the cost but really hope they add more chapeters.

I am a big fan of puzzel/escape room games in VR and this does not dissapoint what so ever. Great puzzles with just the right amount of challenge along with a good story and even better audio and graphics. Well done! I cannot wait to see what this studio comes up with next.

review_title: One of the better escape room games
one_reviews_text: This is probably the best escape room game in VR I've played, though still not really appealing to me.  The graphics are excellent, the puzzles are ok-ish, seems a decent amount of content.  If you like puzzle and/or escape room games, this is easy to recommend.  If you aren't already a fan of that genre, this won't change your mind.

I had already been through Room 1 through Room 4 on my iPad and couldn't wait for this new episode in VR. I was not disappointed! Fireproof has done a wonderful job of creating a similar mystical feel of the 2D games in A Dark Matter. I played this through in a couple of days, trying not to rely too much on the hints, which are there when you need them. Fireproof is definitely on my watchlist for any new games to come out! They have the right formula for creating amazing puzzle games, and they've unlocked that formula now in VR. You will not be disappointed. Flawless graphics, perfect soundtrack, great level of difficulty. I'm all over this! I can't wait for their next episode. Meanwhile, I'll be going through this one again!!

I am a fan of the mobile games. Very engrossing and highly polished. I couldn't wait to play the new VR game and I was truly blown away. What a magical experience to be fully immersed inside the game. The gameplay, the atmospere, the puzzles, are all top notch. I couldn't fault this. With all the bad stuff going on in the world at the moment, this is pure escapism.  Hats off to the devs for a first class experience.

review_title: A Must buy for any "the room" fans
one_reviews_text: The game has the same style and feel as the other titles, but better as it is in a VR environment. If you like the other titles, you will almost certainly like this game. The controls for the Glass viewer on/off didnt agree with me too much, but it wasnt anything that ruined the game. Fairly difficult, and certainly immersive. A+++ Title

I have been a big fan of the mobile The Room games and am a huge fan of this entry into VR.  No puzzles are so difficult that will cause you to walk away from the game.  There are no jump scares, timed events, or quick reflex actions required.  What this game has is an abundance of eeiry atmostphere (a staple of all previous The Room games) and exceptional puzzle mechanics and environment.  You may have to use a hint here and there but by no means will you ever get stuck or frustrated.  As with all VR games, I wish it had a longer playing experience but I am absolutely pleased with the polish and presentation of this game.  This is the gold standard for immersion, escape rooms, and VR technology.  Can not recommend this game enough.

review_title: The PERFECT game for MY tastes.
one_reviews_text: I REALLY enjoyed this game, playing it to completion!  I'm a computer graphics artist/programmer and I mostly "play" games to admire/examine their implementation and craftsmanship.  Finishing ANY computer game, either VR or 2D on a PC/Xbox, is VERY rare for me so the fact I actually completed this game is quite a recommendation from me.  I completed it in under 7 hours and did it without activating the "clues" option or otherwise getting any help.  I generally very much DISlike FPS and gravitate much more to the puzzle/mystery/open-world type games.  The puzzles in this game were just the right level of challenge -- they were not overly technical or computationally taxing or otherwise mentally onerous. Rather, like all truly good puzzles, they mostly came down to being observant and being able to step back and think outside the box.  The game has beautiful graphics and ran without any problems whatsoever.  HIGHLY recommended for those who like non-FPS games.  THANKS!

This was my first experience with "The Room" series, and it was a great one! 
 Though the video gives you a small taste, I wasn't anticipating how dense the UI was with puzzles, many of them interlocking and building on one another.  I was able to get through with 1 clue, and when I pulled that clue I almost smacked myself in the forehead.  The failing was in my thinking, and the game had given me every chance to succeed, but I didn't realize it until I pulled that clue!

To me, that says great design.

In the end my only complaint was that bringing up my inventory broke my immersion a bit, especially to activate my eyepiece.  Two things I feel would improve this experience:

1>  Simply ask us to tap the side of our VR Headset with a finger.  It could trigger the lens when our hand gets close enough, so no real tap is needed, and would have felt smooth.

2> Have a virtual 'bag' that we can pull up from over our shoulder (hip is bad for seated gameplay) with a grab, like Saints and Sinners.  That way we feel like we're interacting with something in the world.  Make the current inventory an option for accessibility.


Overall, a fantastic experience, and I'm really looking forward to more in the future!  Maybe a.... MULTIPLAYER EXPERIENCE!  :o
Thanks!

Fireproof games have made another exceptional quality game. The puzzle design is imaginitive, clever and logical. All of the clues are there and the is no guess work required to solve the puzzles. There is a hint system if you get really stuck, but use as an absolute last resort. The graphics are stunning. The controls are intuative, the movement is slick and comfortable. This is how to make a VR game.

Flawless game mechanics. The game flowed so smoothly in VR that the hour I scheduled for play stretched quickly into 3 hours with nary a blink. There were several different types of puzzles, but the puzzles that involved the interplay with scale were most intriguing. Such puzzles take advantage of VR in an imaginative way. That is, you not only look at an old organ, play the organ, but jump inside the organ... to fix the pipes. Very clever.

The graphics are beautiful. Wished for more story. That said, I found this VR puzzle game immensely enjoyable!

review_title: What a great VR Escape Room Experience!!
one_reviews_text: I thoroughly enjoyed this VR Escape Room game, and highly recommended it.  Immersion is fantastic.  Puzzles were challenging and entertaining without being absurdly difficult or outlandish.  I was able to solve them all without resorting to hints, but they are conveniently available so I would assume any type of player would be able to enjoy the game flow.  I was a bit surprised that the relative level of puzzle difficulty vascillated from easy to hard to easy again as you progressed through levels, as opposed to just becoming harder. It was also very nice that you can play this game either seated or standing and not affect the gameplay (seated was great because you can be playing for several hours beginning to end).  Again I completely recommend this game - well done!!  I hope they come out with another soon!

I've played every mobile version of The Room but seeing it come to life in VR is a master piece of visual and sound effects. The puzzles are interesting and challenging but not so much to cause any frustration.
If you like puzzle games, and especially if you liked the smartphone Room games, you'll love this.

review_title: This is what VR was made for!
one_reviews_text: I’ve been playing The Room games for years on mobile and have always been blown away by the eerie storyline, haunting music and amazing puzzles. When I heard the latest game was coming to VR platforms only, I knew I had to get a VR headset and I’m glad I did. This game truly is the next evolution in The Room saga and feels extremely immersive. It really feels like you are in this world and the puzzles are very fun with the VR dynamic and rarely frustrating as I feared. I only wish it was longer, but that’s just a testament to how well done this game is! Absolute must buy!

Having played all 4 The Room games on mobile, I was imidietly intriuged by the announcement of an entry for VR. The atmosphere that I'd so loved on mobile and the detailed puzzle box / escape room puzzles should work brilliantly in VR! Let me start by saying I was in no way dissapointed.

Everything I loved about the first three games, from the eyepiece effects (even including it's additional features from The Room 3 where you shrink down into mechanisms) translate brilliantly into VR, and are even improved upon. The shrinking down into mechanisms is done better than ever before, where you'll solve puzzles from both inside and outside mechanisms.

Speaking of the puzzles, they're back and as brilliant as ever, where there's always enough to guide you forward and if you're ever feeling lost, the subtle multi-tier hints system really helps give you a nudge in the right direction without telling you the answer. Especially given these are some of the most complicated 'rooms' we've ever been placed in, this helpful directional pointer is as appriciated now as it ever was.

Previous 'The Room' fans will not be dissapointed, as this game is jam packed full of story, mechanics and references to the other games, though implimented in such a way that new users to this game won't feel alionated. Knowladge of prior games is never tested or required, but some threads from these are drawn to a close here in a satisfying way, though no doubt the ending will be just as satisfying for those playing only this entry.

The teleportation system is a brilliant way of navigating the room and drawing the user's attention to the useful areas, and while I do miss the gradual sweeping of movement from the room's 2 to 4, I can see how this could have been unconfortable in VR, so even that element isn't displeasing and while a departure, works great in this game.

I would love to see more The Room in VR! Would strongly reccomend for puzzle fans and 'Room' fans alike!

I loved all of the previous smartphone games you guys have made and I absolutely freaked out when I heard there was going to be a VR version. You guys really knocked it out of the park in terms of perspective and atmosphere. Still chilling as always and stunning visuals. BRAVO GUYS!
Fireproof games has time and again made the best escape the room games. The Room VR is no exception.

Perfect puzzle game for VR. Challenging puzzles, mostly not too hard. Only twice did I need I need a hint to solve, and then only the first of 3 hints provided. So if you are impatient with puzzles, it does not hinder your enjoyement of the rest of the game, which is really mind blowing. 
     The mind blowing part includes the best graphics, animations, and sounds that create an erie atmospheric embience that totally encompasses you like a VR game should do. 
     I would have enjoyed exploring the environements a little more freely, but the teleportation method puts you right in front of the puzzles you need to solve, so that mechanic did little to detract from the experience. 
     I highly recommend this game. Good Job devs!

review_title: So Much Fun. Can't wait 4 the next one!
one_reviews_text: I Have played all of the PC Room titles and the developers did a classy job of adapting a beloved favorite into the VR space. <3<3
no words required except buy it now!!! love this game! it is one of the best on the oculus rift!

I am a big fan of the smartphone versions. While this wasn't tremendously long, I thought it was just right. Some of the puzzles were quite complicated but they always have the hints to help you. The ONLY thing I might like is free reign to explore the world, but it does help solve the puzzles.

A lot of the negative reviews of this title complain about the length.
Something to understand about VR titles, in my opinion, is the shorter length compared to standard games.
This title hits the sweet spot of being long enough to sink one's teeth into, without overstaying it's welcome. The puzzles are fun and interesting, with a real sense of accomplishment when you figure them out. The hint system is very well-done, providing a little push in the right direction, or a much more specific hint if you're still stuck.

There was one small glitch about 2/3 way through, involving a door that didn't open properly, but returning to the main menu and re-entering the save fixed it.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed every moment of this game, and I'm happy with the purchase. Considering the price of two trips to the movie theater, the price-to-length ratio is perfectly in line with my expectations of a VR game.

Thanks, devs, for your hard work! Looking forward to the next one!

review_title: The Room was ment for VR
one_reviews_text:
I've played all "The room" games on my smartphone and I love the puzzles, ever since the first game I've dreamed of solving these types of puzzles in VR.
It finally happened and Fireproof games did NOT disappoint!

A strong recommendation to play this game!

The only nitpicking I have about the game is that you will turn your "Lens" on and off a lot of times, you do this but opening your Inventory and then switching the lens on and off. This should be a button press or hold on the side of the VR headset like an actual lens, but no.

This game fulfills all the requirements for a great VR app, No Motion Sickness due to the teleport mechanics, offering sitting or standing mode for those with difficulty standing for long periods of time, I  finished the first section and thought WOW that was a great game, worth every penny to then discover i had only done 1/4 of the game.. Worth the money if you like their previous games on mobile/pc (the room, the room 2, the room 3, the room: ancient sins. Fireproof Games have again pulled an amazing experience from their collective brains, Wish i could get a job working for them but I guess I don't have the brains for it they are geniuses.
Worth Every penny. When can we have more!!!!

I loved the previous Room games and this one did not disappoint.

* Graphics, the art style works really well in VR where you can truly appreciate the painstaking detail that the devs put into their environment and puzzles.

* Gameplay, I'll say what I thought since playing the first The Room game... It would work amazing in VR and this one did not disappoint, the teleportation movment is similar to how it works in previous games. Generally not my cup of tea, but I don't mind it in this game as it's more about solving the puzzles not moving and shooting.

* Puzzles, no complaints, might been a bit easy but I chalk it down to having played all the other The Room games and understanding what to expect, but they were still causing head scratches in certain parts. But it was always satisfying to find the solution. I do wish there'd been more puzzle boxes akin to the original The Room game on the phone, mostly because I feel the move to VR would really open up the ability to have them. The ability to touch, move, twist and turn, inspect the puzzles would make it even better.

* Verdict, 10/5 I love the atmosphere of the games and it works well in VR, specially in the final part... Quite creepy... I will say the pages were a nice touch along with the iconic eyepiece. I do severely hope the Devs intend for a sequel or another VR Room game, while VR is kind of niche this style of game is really fitting for the media and allows for such creativity with the puzzles. Highly recommended despite the pricy, price tag. This will surely be a game I'll use to Demo VR for friends and family.

i could expect no less from the geniuses at fireproof games, the game certianly holds an eerie atmosphere that keeps your hair on edge, the puzzles are challenging, yet sensible enough to not be confusing or frustrating, and being a diehard room fan it made me very happy to see familiar references to earlier pieces of the series, even room 3 was mentioned, yet beatifully enough its not perfectly clear which ending was chosen, as well as the introduction of new charecters as well, and ending was as you could expect from a room ending, "im not entirely sure what happened but it looks like it turned out okay" all in all I have almost nothing but praise to say for the game. the only concern i might have is with movement, while you do get used to teleporting pretty quickly having a sort of railed locomotion would nicer, like you kinda glide from your point to the one you would be teleporting to, like in The Room 3. bottom line its worth every penny, whether you like eerie game, puzzles games, magical games, history games, this is something worth playing
kudos to you fireproof and i hope you continue
Congratulations to the Room team, you have really created a trully awesome expierience that I would share and probably play again. Thank you so much. I hope make a sequel.

review_title: The best VR Room Escape for the moment!!
one_reviews_text: The best VR Room Escape for the moment!!
I have been enjoying The Room games for years now on my phone and PC so I am EXTREMELY excited to now be able to play it in VR! Amazing details and graphics, and it's just the right amount of creepy

Since the first Room game I've wanted them to make a VR game, and this was everything I had hoped for. This is my new gold standard for what a VR game should be. Immersive, engaging, totally comfortable, and absolutely gorgeous.

I can't wait for their next one! :)

I own and design physical escape games and this one was fantastic!
Very immersive with fun puzzles. Hours of game play and I agree with some of the reviewers this is what VR is supposed to be all about.
Truly amazing experience. I already love real excape rooms, and VR really takes it to another level. superb game. craving more.

review_title: Fireproof always makes the best games
one_reviews_text: Ive played every game from this series that fireproof has produced and they are always 5 star games. This VR version is just another masterpeice. I look forward to the next one.

review_title: What the room has been waiting for
one_reviews_text: I love The Room games and the VR version takes it to the next level. Worth every penny.
Wish there was more because I never wanna stop playing! Super fun and enjoyed it a ton!
this was my first vr puzzle game and it was simply amazing. no bugs. just fun challenges. well worth the money spent!
This is the fourth installment of The Room and by far the best. If you haven't played them all, check out the first three. They just get better and better each time!

Finaly a perfect escape room game .
bit short :-)
just finished,  downloaded the game last night..
This is definitely one of the best games I have played in vr, such an immersive and fun experience, I would highly recommend this to anyboody looking for a good puzzle game to play.
This game brings all the ingenuity and polish of the original Room games to VR. Great puzzles, spine-tingling atmosphere and an intriguing story. Excellent!
Really good puzzle game !

I have played all of the Room chapters on my phones over the years, so HAD to try this out once I got my new headset. Loved every second of it. The atmosphere is phenomenal. I wouldn't mind it being a little longer or another chapter added to via a download in the future, rather than another separate game given the price of this one. Even so, it was worth every penny, I just have a problem with binging and trying to get to the end in one sitting. If you can, take a break and make this one last a few days of gameplay.
Its felt a fair bit shorter than the phone games but it was absolutely worth it to play it in VR. It was a stunning world!! A MUST play
Welove this as much if not more than the mobile games. Can't wait for more. 10/10
This is the best game out there on VR and i hope there is new quest comming soon
Loved it! Great ending.
amazing game.  Buy it!  one downside... too short.
Simply brilliant!! Produce more of these!!

There's not much more I can say about this game that hasn't already. I love The Room series and was excited when I found out they had a VR game. Excelent puzzles and a great story to go with it. I only got stuck once at the clock in the cathedral and that was because I was an idiot. No spoilers, but Fireproof did adress it on the FAQ on their website.  I wish there was more to play and I look forward to a continuation of this world and story.
Quality game for the price.  Although movement is teleporation based, it fits well with this type of game.  Great sound and ambience.

Being someone who started with text based adventure games like Zork and moving up through the first graphics based such as King's Quest/Space Quest and then the 7th Guest it is a great step forward to be immersed in an adventure/puzzle type game.  And without revealing clues in this comment you now have 360 degree views you need to take advantage of instead of your view being fixed in a particular area while you work a puzzle.  When you play you will know what I am talking about.  Excited to see where this goes for future games.

Awesome game. wife and I did half each. 
Woulda been five stars if view/orientation stayed fixed on the same point when teleporting, a verrrry minor issue. would help immersion I think. 
Def. recommend

I've played The Room 1,2,3 on Steam so I have been looking forward to this for a while.

The puzzles and ideas are quite similar to the previous games, yet this requires you to interact and move around the environment instead of just 1 box.

Where you can move to is clearly marked and it's via teleportation. This is extremely useful as it stops you from guessing what you would have to do and instead you are aware of where you need to go or where the answer may lay.

It is definitely worth the money and I would encourage anyone who likes puzzles or escape rooms to give this a go.

Hints are available if needed, and I definitely had to use 1 or 2 on the Third chapter. I knew what I needed to do but the device/way to do it was very obscure and I didn't notice it. 

The biggest compliment I can give the game is that I won't play it all in one go as I will have nothing to look forward to. I'm taking it 1 chaper per day as I want to drag out my experience .
The issue with the Room games though is replayability, you will need to leave it for a year or so and forget the ways to solve the puzzles before playing again.
I would't classify this as a horror game, however, the eerie music and dark rooms are just a lil scary.

Seriously, this game is amazing if you like puzzle and escape room, I really liked everything !!! 2 thing I haven't liked, the last enigme, after the wich house are juste too easy, I don't want to say to much because I don't like spoil, but the part avec the wich need to be more...fabulous...., the second thing is that we need moaaaarrr chapter ! it's too short, I'm already adicte XD finished the game in 5h... omg I played 5h and it's like 1h because the game is so good :)

First time that I've played The Room and I'm really glad having bying this game. Great atmosphere, a little creepy, great story so far ... for the ones that like escape room, I would recommend without hesitation. 
I feel sometimes that it is too easy, I only payed too chapters, hopefully it willl take me some times too finish the game.

This game is just WOW! I've played all the games on my tablet and I loved them soooo much, and this VR one is just so immersive and amazing. Controls feel good, the puzzles live up to the other games standards. You should definitely play it if you like the other games!

Once again, Fireproof Games shows they are a AAA studio. As a huge fan of th the Room series, and yes it's a bit short and pricey, this simply is the best of it's VR escape room game that I've played (with Form coming up in second place).
Can't wait for the next installment.
Thanks again, Fireproof!

Only one chapter in, but love the series and this doesn't disappoint. The story and puzzles and general mood of the game seem great.

Only concern is the VR experience was a tiny bit uncomfortable at times. I don't think it's the fault of the mechanics of the game though, maybe frame rate on my 980ti?. 

It would be great if there was a better way for spectators to follow along. My wife found it too unconfortable to watch (due to the view point moving with my head motion).

review_title: Well... easily the best game on Quest
one_reviews_text: I have played numerous games on Quest and up to this game... I had other favorites but of course this one beats them all! I've been big fan of the mobile games but never I would have expected them to release something on VR. Found out some days ago and then I immediately bought the game as soon as it was available. I completed the game in less than two days, so one could say it's a bit short but it is very polished and the graphics and story are very well designed. I will be eagerly waiting for the next VR chapter!

This game is a must have, amazing graphics, fantastic puzzles, brilliant story line and has plenty of content to certainly be value for money. I'll but whatever you make next if it is anything like that again.

This is the best VR experience i have had for an Adventure Game.
Its so engrossing and mind blowing.

Anyone with a VR headset without the App hasnt done justice to the world of Virtual Reality...

Please we need more of such experience .
Thumbs up to the developers

Very good game, but in the church i cann't access to set up the second cadran on the church clock, i have acess only on two gearing among the three possible.

Thanks for an answer.

review_title: Best thing to happen to The Room series
one_reviews_text:
I ahve played every The Room game so far and hev to say bringing it to VR was the best thing that could have happened to the series.

Now to just wait for the next one to come out

Fireproof games advanced to the next level in game play. They knocked it out of the park with this VR version. I've played every single game they've produced and this was by far the best! Keep up the great work, now get crackin at part 2!
Long time lover of this developer and these games. This is the opus. This is marvelous. Thank you so much!!!!! AH Amazing!
I've been waiting so long for a game like this. A masterpiece. Fot those who like to solve riddles a must. And there are sooooo many of them. Thank you so much for producing this amazing game!
I have always enjoyed The Room games, I have played every one that has been released and I can say the same for all of them, they are fantastic, Fireproof Games never ceases to amaze me.
Incredible game. Just as in their previous releases, this one hits spot on.

review_title: how i can get back money?
one_reviews_text: how i can get back money?
review_feedback: Sorry to hear you didn't enjoy the game. If there is something gameplay related that we can help with, please contact us on info@fireproofgames.com. Otherwise you'll need to contact Oculus Support for any refund related questions.
